S.FORM: make o dilimʣuŋ u-mam patsoksi u-pap-kam ʦɯ-mim
S.TRANSL: Long ago, there were children with a mother, Dilimjung, and a father, Pachoksi.

S.FORM: kʰakʦilip ri əni ʣau kʰleu nwale riʦɯ-ʦip ʣəmma tin-ʣana ba-mri ʔe
S.TRANSL: K and his two sisters J and K lived together, the three of them.

S.FORM: mɯrmim-kam tin ʣana ba-mri ʦɤŋɖa tura dym-miri-ma ba-mri
S.TRANSL: The three of them later became orphans.

S.FORM: əni me dui bəhini ri-ka ʦʰəhi ri-ʦip-ka kʰakʦilip u-ri-kam herʦar bet-tʰal-ʦi sihar susar bet-tʰal-ʦi ʔe
S.TRANSL: And the two sisters took care of their brother K and looked after him.

S.FORM: ʣəmma tərə mɯ kʰakʦilip ʦʰəhi ʦɯm brepa bai-ra
S.TRANSL: But altogether, K was very lazy.

S.FORM: kam kole wo me-be-pa bai-tʰal-la ʔe
S.TRANSL: He did no work at all.

S.FORM: ʣəmma mɯ wo nwale ri-ʦip-ka rep-tʰal-ʦi
S.TRANSL: His two sisters looked after him.

S.FORM: kʰana gwak-tʰal-ʦi ʔe ʦape ɖupe bet-tʰal-ʦi ʔe
S.TRANSL: They gave him food, and housed him.

S.FORM: əni ʦɤŋɖa ʦʰəhi dʰerəi səməe pəʦari guʦi dikɖɤr dym-ʦi-ŋa gərdakʰeri
S.TRANSL: After that, after lots of time, the two of them became exhausted.

S.FORM: kolem ʦʰəhi oram ʦʰəhi brepa dys-ta saro ŋa iʦi-sɯ py-ry-ma oram ʦʰəhi əbə guʦi sen-ʦi-ma lɤ-ʦi
S.TRANSL: One day [they said] "he has become so lazy, he is eating us alive, let us kill him and leave.

S.FORM: bun-ʦi-ma kortʰɯ lɤ-ʦi oram sen-ʣɯl-ʦi lɤ-ʦi
S.TRANSL: We'll go to another place, we'll abandon him and go."

S.FORM: ra-beʈ-ʦi-ma uʦi-walwak-ka ʣau-nuŋ kʰleu-nuŋ-ka ʦʰəhi səlla bet-ʦi ʔe
S.TRANSL: they said, and J and K came to a decision.

S.FORM: əni meɖɖa-m pəʦʰi kolem ʦʰipʣi-kam nem bɤne-saka mɯ-gunu u-ri kʰakʦilip-lai am-saka
S.TRANSL: Then after that they made a house out of pieces of big bamboo, and put their brother K to sleep inside it.

S.FORM: əni mina mɯ-ɖɤla nem-ɖɤla ʦəhi prok-ʦi ʔe prok-ʦi-ma ʦʰipʣi hɤŋko ʣɤs-ta lo ʦʰəhi
S.TRANSL: And they jumped on it, on the house, and when it broke into so many pieces,

S.FORM: iʦi-ri-kam kərəŋ ŋa ʦɤk-ʦi sat kərəŋ ʦɤk-ʦi si-ra lɤ-ʦi
S.TRANSL: "We broke our brother's ribs, we broke 7 ribs, now he's dead, let's go."

S.FORM: rak-ʦi-m guʦi huʈ-ʦi-ma lɤk-ʦi
S.TRANSL: they said, and then they flew away and left.

S.FORM: lɤk-ʦi əni lɤk-ʦi-m pəʦʰi memlo kʰakʦilip ʦʰəhi me-si-saka hunuktʰjo ələkgai ba-saka rep-tʰaɖ-ɖy rəmita rep-tʰaɖ-ɖy ʔe
S.TRANSL: After they left, K, who hadn't died, and was over alone a little farther off, watched the scene.

S.FORM: əni ri-ʦip lɤk-ʦi-m pəʦʰi mɯrʦip bʰante lɤk-ʦi tʰa me-by-ba kʰakʦilip-ka
S.TRANSL: And after the sisters left, K did not know where they went.

S.FORM: əni meɖɖa-m pəʦʰi ʦɤŋra kʰakʦilip ʦʰəhi u-tak ŋa dys-ta bʰai-ra-m bʰai-ra memsaka bat-to ʦɤŋra kʰola-ra ŋo seɖ-ɖa lɤs-ta ʔe
S.TRANSL: After that, K was alone, and later, he went to the river to fish.

S.FORM: lɤs-ta-ma ŋo seʈ-to reʈ-to pet-to bat-to by-tʰal-ly ʔe memsaka
S.TRANSL: He went and killed a fish, and brought it and ate it and was.

S.FORM: əni ʦɤŋra memsaka bet-to bet-to lɤs-ta-lo kolem ʦʰəhi kʰola-ra paluŋ ob-ɖy-lo luŋ huŋ-ɖa ʔe
S.TRANSL: Then later, he went one day and threw his fish net in the river and caught a stone.

S.FORM: kʰali kole luŋ koŋŋa huŋ-ɖa ʔe
S.TRANSL: Again and again, only the stone came into his net.

S.FORM: kʰali paluŋ ob-ɖy luŋ koŋŋa huŋ-ɖa ʔe grok-y ʔe
S.TRANSL: He threw his net again and again, and only a stone entered, and he threw it away.

S.FORM: memsaka nwak-pəʈək suk-pəʈək ʦʰəhi luŋ grok-ty
S.TRANSL: He threw the stone like that two times, three times.

S.FORM: ʦɤŋra wo pʰeri ŋa paluŋ ob-ɖy-m pʰeri luŋ ŋa huŋ-ɖa mɯram luŋ ʦʰəhi
S.TRANSL: And later as well, he again threw the net and the stone entered.

S.FORM: oram wo kʰorsani jo kʰorsani hi-kʰop bɤn-i-lo ny rak-saka kʰeɖ-ɖy kur-ry-ma kʰeɖ-ɖy
S.TRANSL: "Let's make that stone a grinding stone for salt and chili" he said, and carried it and brought it up.

S.FORM: mɯ-nuŋ ŋo wo me-seʈ-ba ʔe
S.TRANSL: Even with that, he killed no fish.

S.FORM: əni kʰeɖ-ɖy-ma meɖɖa-m pəʦʰi mɯ luŋ mɯram loro ʦʰəhi kʰeɖ-ɖy-ma ʦɤrʦi-ra pʰik-ɖy ʔe
S.TRANSL: He brought the stone up and put that round stone into a bamboo basket.

S.FORM: ʦɤrʦi-ra pʰik-ɖy-ma meɖɖa-m pəʦʰi pʰeri u-dika-m memsaka ŋo seɖ-ɖa lɤs-ta ʔe
S.TRANSL: He put it in the basket and then the next day he went to kill some fish.

S.FORM: əni ŋo seɖ-ɖa lɤs-ta-lo ŋo kʰola-ra seɖ-ɖy rok-ta əni rok-ta-lo ʦəhi neb-ra ʣəmma wo kʰanapina ʣəmma kʰo-m-tʰap-ma ʣəmma ʈʰik be-m-tʰap-ma bai-ra ʔe
S.TRANSL: And he went to fish and killed a fish in the river and when he came everything to eat and drink was already cooked and ready in the house.

S.FORM: əni meɖɖa-m pəʦʰi ʦʰəka dys-ta ʔe
S.TRANSL: And he was surprised.

S.FORM: sy-ka by-ry oram ho
S.TRANSL: Who did this?

S.FORM: sy wo me-bu-mi asinɖa
S.TRANSL: There is noone here.

S.FORM: sy-ka be-ŋ-sa-ŋri-ma lɤk-ta memsaka etʰa utʰa rep-bal-ly myʦy wo me-las-y-ba
S.TRANSL: Who did this for me" and he looked here and there and found noone.

S.FORM: tərə meɖɖa-m pəʦʰi bʰa-ma bʰansa kʰo-ma bʰansa py-ry ʔe
S.TRANSL: After that he ate the prepared food.

S.FORM: memsaka pʰeri u-dika-m memsaka lɤs-ta pʰeri ŋo seɖ-ɖa
S.TRANSL: And the next day he again went fishing.

S.FORM: ŋo seɖ-ɖy-ma pʰeri rok-ta
S.TRANSL: He killed a fish and came back again.

S.FORM: mɯ nem wo memsaka ŋa kʰo-ma bai-ra ʔe
S.TRANSL: That day too, things were cooked like that.

S.FORM: dindinəi memsaka ŋa gu ŋa ŋo seɖ-ɖa lɤk-pa rok-pa tərə kʰana kʰo-m-tʰap-ma dym-pa
S.TRANSL: Every day he went fishing and came back like that but the food was already prepared.

S.FORM: əni memma rak-ta pakʰanu jes-ta ʔe
S.TRANSL: And outside it would be called:

S.FORM: sy bu-ni ama hopmam ama ʦape ɖupe be-pa ɖukʰə be-pa rok-a boru kojokojo ŋa po-ʦi
S.TRANSL: "Who are you who does my food and accommodation like this, who suffers like this; come, let us eat together.

S.FORM: bʰansa wo bɤn-tʰal-na sy ho
S.TRANSL: Who are you, you made the food?

S.FORM: sy tʰɤnsi-na sy po-na-mim ho rem-bes-a rok-a-ma boru kʰana po-ʦi byr-y ʔe ma jes-ta ʔe
S.TRANSL: Why is it that you are hiding? Come and let's eat" he said and called.

S.FORM: pakʰa-ra əni memlo kole ŋami luk-ta jes-ta
S.TRANSL: Then an old lady came outside.

S.FORM: go be-uto-m mɯraŋ-ka
S.TRANSL: "I did it", she said and called.

S.FORM: bʰansa go kʰok-to-m rak-ta-ma rak-ta ʔe
S.TRANSL: "I'm the one who cooked the food" she said.

S.FORM: meɖɖamma ŋami jeɖ-ɖy-m meɖɖa-m pəʦʰi bʰansa pet-ʦi dui ʣana
S.TRANSL: Then after the woman called, they ate rice.

S.FORM: bʰansa pet-ʦi əni meɖɖa-m pəʦʰi u-dika-m ʦʰəhi mɯ ŋami-ka sɯi-ry ʔe kʰakʦilip-lai
S.TRANSL: They ate, and after that, the next day, the old woman said to K:

S.FORM: oram gana dika ʦʰəhi ŋo seɖ-ɖa lɤk-pa li-sa-ma lɤks-a
S.TRANSL: "You, tomorrow act like you are going fishing, and go.

S.FORM: tərə naŋlo-nuŋ kuʦo-nuŋ kur-ler-a kur-a-ma ʦʰəkkə pindikuna-go-ra mɯ naŋlo-ka kʰrems-a kuʦo mɯ-go-ra ʣyl-a
S.TRANSL: Take the winnowing basket and broom and cover yourself with the basket in the corner of the covered porch and place the broom there.

S.FORM: meɖɖa-m pəʦʰi mɯram bʰansa kʰok-pa myʦy ro memlo naŋlo kuʦo mal-y
S.TRANSL: After that, when the person who cooks the food comes, then she will search for the basket and broom.

S.FORM: mɯram tʰari mal-to mal-to ro-ma naŋlo ʣer-y-lo
S.TRANSL: At that time, she will come and search and search and when she holds the winnowing basket,

S.FORM: naŋlo pʰop-ɖa lɤ memlo ʦʰəhi ʈʰikə u-dahine pakʰora-ra ʣer-a wo mɯraŋ ŋa sɯ i-ʦape ɖupe be-pa rak-ta-ma siɖ-ɖy ʔe
S.TRANSL: She will come to get the basket, at that point take her right arm really well, that one [whose] meat is making your food and lodging" she said and taught him.

S.FORM: meɖɖa-m pəʦʰi mɯram kʰakʦilip-ka mɯram by-ry
S.TRANSL: After that, K did that.

S.FORM: naŋlo-nuŋ kuʦo-nuŋ ʣer...tʰɑky kʰrems-ta bai-ra-m
S.TRANSL: He held the basket and the broom, and hid.

S.FORM: memsamma mɯ ʦɤrʦi-lam luŋ ʦʰəhi ʦjapljapkai rak-pa ka-jy lus-ta ʔe
S.TRANSL: Then the stone jumped down out of the basket making a falling sound.

S.FORM: naŋlo kuʦo mal-mu ʦɯm-ry ʔe
S.TRANSL: And she started searching for the basket and broom.

S.FORM: ʦɯm-to ʦɯm-to bʰante ʣyl-ly ham sy-ma rak-to pʰut-to eso pakʰanu luk-ta ʔe
S.TRANSL: She started and started [looking] and complaining and saying "where did he put it" she went outside.

S.FORM: pindi-ra naŋlo ʈʰikəi hor-ry-lo ʈʰikəi kʰakʦilip-ka pəhila ŋami-ka siɖ-ɖy-m hoŋŋa pakʰora-ra ʣeɖ-ɖy ʔe
S.TRANSL: When she opened the basket on the front port, K, like the old woman had taught him, grabbed her by the arm.

S.FORM: ʣeɖ-ɖy-m pəʦʰi meɖɖamma gana reʦa rak-ta mɯ riʦɯ ʣeɖ-ɖy kole riʦɯ bai-ra-m
S.TRANSL: After grabbing her, he said "it's you" and it was a girl.

S.FORM: mɯ ʦɤrʦi-lam al-pa luŋ ʦʰəhi riʦɯ dys-ta memsaka by-ry ʔe əni mɯram riʦɯ ʦʰəhi ʣeɖ-ɖy-lo
S.TRANSL: The stone that had fallen from the basket was a girl, and when he held that girl,

S.FORM: go make ŋa pəhila ŋa go gro-ŋri, luŋ kʰola-go-jy gro-ŋɖi-ma a-kʰərəŋ ŋa ʦɤ-mu dym-na
S.TRANSL: "Long ago, you threw me, you threw me as a stone down into the river, and you broke my rib.

S.FORM: go gana-nuŋ bo-mu-ma po-mu me-ʦa-pu ɖiʈ-ŋi by-ry rak-ta-ma me-bisaba tərə kʰakʦilip-ka me-ɖiʈ-ba ʔe
S.TRANSL: 'I can't be with you and eat with you, leave me" she said but K did not leave her.

S.FORM: meɖɖa-m pəʦʰi mɯrʦip mesinɖa ŋa guʦi ʣəjapəja dym-ʦi ʔe woʦy moʦy dym-ʦi
S.TRANSL: After that, they became a couple there, they became husband and wife.

S.FORM: əni meɖɖa-m pəʦʰi bat-ʦi ʔe
S.TRANSL: And after that, they were.

S.FORM: kʰakʦilip ʦʰəhi kʰasaje u-sip wo me-baʈ-pa bai-ra ʔe
S.TRANSL: K had no skills.

S.FORM: ʦɤŋra ʣəjapəja dym-ʦi-ma bat-ʦi-lo moʦy-ka o moʦy-kam nɤŋ ʦʰəhi wailuŋma
S.TRANSL: Later, after they were married, the wife's name was Wailungma.

S.FORM: wailuŋma ʦʰəhi kiʦɯ sipalo bai-ra ʔe
S.TRANSL: W. was a little skillful.

S.FORM: gu-ka ʦʰəhi siɖ-ɖy ʔe
S.TRANSL: She taught [K].

S.FORM: o ʦokpu ʦanʦakru-ku u-mer hopma ʦʰəhi kapʰe-nuŋ-ma kʰãbo rer-a o nem bɤne-mu-kam lagi u-mer rem-beɖ-ɖy ʔe
S.TRANSL: "Bring a pole which is forked like the tail of the chanchakru bird, to make a house, look at it's tail."

S.FORM: meɖɖamma mepmam rem-beɖ-ɖy ʔe meɖɖa-m pəʦʰi reɖ-ɖy kʰakʦilip-ka mepmam reɖ-ɖy-ma nem bɤnet-ʦi ʔe
S.TRANSL: And he brought one like that and they built a house.

S.FORM: bat-ʦi ham memlo mepmam bat-ʦi memsaka bat-ʦi-ma ʦɤŋra ʦʰəhi mɯ kʰakʦilip-ku u-ri-ʦip bu-ʦi rak-pa tʰa by-ry-m pəʦʰi
S.TRANSL: After that, they lived like that, and later, after she learned that K had two sisters,

S.FORM: ʦɤŋra mina tʰɯs-ty ʔe ʣawaʣyʣimljakmajy omsaka ri-ʦip bu-ʦi
S.TRANSL: Later the two siblings were at J.

S.FORM: dakʰom bet-ʦi mɯ-jy-ɖa bo-ʦi sip bo-ʦi-ma bo-ʦi rak-pa tʰɯs-ty-m pəʦʰi
S.TRANSL: After she heard that they were working the loom down there, working their skill,

S.FORM: gu-ka mɯ u-ri-ʦip mal-la, tʰyr-a, jer-aʦi by-ry-ma mɯ wailuŋma-ka mem by-ry ʔe
S.TRANSL: She said [to him] "search for your two sisters, send for them, call them", and W. did that.

S.FORM: meɖɖa-m pəʦʰi kʰakʦilip-ka pəhila ser tʰyrs-ty ʔe
S.TRANSL: K. first sent a louse.

S.FORM: u-ri-ʦip-lai ser tʰyrs-ty
S.TRANSL: He sent a louse to his sisters.

S.FORM: ser-ka kʰreb-ɖyʦi ʔe
S.TRANSL: That louse bit them.

S.FORM: kʰreb-ɖy-m pəʦʰi pʰeri mɯ ri-ʦip-ka ʦʰəhi mɯ ser wo pirinap-ʦi-ma seʈ-ʦi ʔe
S.TRANSL: After it bit them, the two sisters got rid of the louse and killed it.

S.FORM: əni meɖɖa-m pəʦʰi ʦɤŋra kole ʦikipa tʰyrs-ty ʔe
S.TRANSL: And after that, he sent a flea.

S.FORM: ʦikipa tʰyrs-ty-m ʦikipa mina rɯpʦym-ʦi ʔe ma tərə ʣipte dys-ta ʔe ma mɯram mɯrɯŋa rok-ta ʔe
S.TRANSL: They caught that flea as well, but it slipped away and came back [to K] without [the sisters].

S.FORM: əni pʰeri ʦɤŋra tin pəʈək-ra ʦʰəhi bʰale tʰyrs-ty ʔe
S.TRANSL: And again, the third time, he sent a cock.

S.FORM: sarepo tʰyrs-ty-m pəʦʰi mɯ sarepo-ka ʦʰəhi uʦi-pʰar-ra lɤs-ta-ma ok-ta ʔe
S.TRANSL: After he sent the cock, the cock went near them and crowed.

S.FORM: kʰukurikã kʰakʦilipo rak-to ok-ta ʔe
S.TRANSL: He crowed saying "kukurika khakcilipo".

S.FORM: əni memlo mɯrʦip-ka ʦʰəhi mɯ ʣau kʰleu-ka ʦʰəhi
S.TRANSL: And then the two of them, J and K, [said]:

S.FORM: si-p-ljak-pa ri-ku nɤŋ sɯ-pa oram bʰante-m sy-kam ne o po rok-ta rak-to ʣʰətti-ka op-ʦi ʔe
S.TRANSL: "this chicken telling us the name of our dead brother, where did it come from, whose did it come from?" and they threw a stick [at him].

S.FORM: əni memlo pʰeri mɯ bʰale-ka kole u-mer dɤs-ʣɯl-ly ʔe mesinɖa
S.TRANSL: And then the cock dropped one of his tail [feathers].

S.FORM: əni meɖɖa-m pəʦʰi pʰeri lɤk-ʦi ʔe dɯt-ʦi ʔe
S.TRANSL: Then after that, they went again and picked up the cock's tail [feather].

S.FORM: pʰeri ŋa mɯ bʰale ok-ta ʔe memsaka ŋa
S.TRANSL: And the cock crowed again.

S.FORM: kʰukurika rak-to kʰakʦilipo rak-to by-ry-m pəʦʰi ʣʰətti pʰeri op-ʦi ʔe
S.TRANSL: And he crowed, and they threw a stick at him again.

S.FORM: mem bet-to mem bet-to mɯ bʰale-ku mer dɤks-y ʔe
S.TRANSL: Doing that, the cock dropped a tail [feather].

S.FORM: pʰeri ŋa hunuktʰjo lɤ pʰeri memsaka ok-to memsaka kʰakʦilip-ku nɤŋ sɯt-to by-ry ʔe ma
S.TRANSL: And again he went a little farther, and crowed, and said K's name.

S.FORM: memsaka bʰale kʰaʈ-to kʰaʈ-to lɤk-ʦi ʔe ma ʈʰjakkəi kʰakʦilip-ku neb-ɖa rok-tʰiʈ-ʦi ʔe
S.TRANSL: And they followed the cock and then arrived at K's house.

S.FORM: meɖɖa-m pəʦʰi mɯ bʰale memsaka reɖ-ɖy
S.TRANSL: After that, the cock brought them [there] like that.

S.FORM: memlo mɯ kʰakʦilip la-ʦi
S.TRANSL: Then they saw their brother K.

S.FORM: kʰakʦilip la-ʦi-m pəʦʰi uʦi u-mina-ka ŋabuŋ-ka ʦʰəhi pʰu-ry-huʈ-ʦi
S.TRANSL: Then they saw K.

S.FORM: pʰeri ʣau kʰleu pʰu-ry-huʈ-ʦi-ma lɤk-ʦi ʔe
S.TRANSL: J and K again flew off and left.

S.FORM: memlo wailuŋma-ka ʦʰəhi ʈʰjakkəi naŋlo-ra riʦi hum-ɖy
S.TRANSL: W. spread out small, sour fruit on the winnowing basket.

S.FORM: hum-saɖ-ɖyʦi-m pəʦʰi riʦi lat-ʦi-m pəʦʰi mɯrʦip pʰeri ri-ʦip ʣyrpa-ku mina-ka swaʈ-ka gərdakʰeri mɯrʦip pʰeri ʣʰuk-ʦi ʔe
S.TRANSL: After she spread out the fruit, and after they saw it, the two, with the bitter taste, they landed again.

S.FORM: mesinɖa ŋa ʣʰuk-ʦi ʣʰuk-ʦi-m pəʦʰi ram-ma ʦʰəhi əni mɯttamma pʰeri pəhila ʣəmma seʈ-ʦoko-m rak-ʦi-m
S.TRANSL: There, from where they landed, they said again "we killed him before".

S.FORM: əni memma mɯram-kam ri-kam ʦʰəhi kʰakʦilip-kam əbə sir pʰɤ-mu bas-ta rak-saka ham ʣəmma mina be-mri-ma muly be-mri-ma
S.TRANSL: And they said "we must make amends to our brother, to K" and they decided this.

S.FORM: meɖɖa-m pəʦʰi mɯ sat kərəŋ ʦɤk-ʦi-m-ka gərdakʰeri omlo bia iki-tʰulu-kam bia bi-lo proʦɯ-kam bia bi-lo ʦʰəhi sat kərəŋ sat tʰan rak-saka mepmam u-riɖ bu
S.TRANSL: Then, because they broke 7 ribs, now when we perform marriages for our Thulung people, when we perform marriages for Rai people, ithe fact that we need 7 ribs and 7 pots has become procedure.

S.FORM: mɯram ʦʰəhi mɯ sat kərəŋ-kam omlo əbə mina ba-kam kərəŋ ŋa mɯram ŋar-mi
S.TRANSL: Nowadays, they count out 7 ribs of a pig.

S.FORM: mɯ sat tʰan-mim-ku sətta ʦʰəhi gʰətet-to lɤ-mri-ma dui tʰan tabo-ku bʰaɖa omsaka ʣyl-li-m bu
S.TRANSL: Instead of those 7 pots, they have decreased [the number] and we now place two copper pots like this.

S.FORM: ri-kam sir pʰɤ-mu-kam lagi, mɯram riti gɤɖ-ɖi ʔe
S.TRANSL: And in order to calm the brother's anger, we set up that system.

S.FORM: mɯram ikima pərəmpərəi omlo səmma dʰot-to ŋa bu
S.TRANSL: This traditional one of ours has been a system until now.

S.FORM: əbə hunuta pəhila-m koti ʦɯm ŋa miju gʰətte dys-ta-ma jok-ta
S.TRANSL: Actually, it's not as much as before.

S.FORM: memsaka kəmti kəmti dym-to mɯram sat tʰan-laŋka dui tʰan-ra rok-jok-ta-m bu
S.TRANSL: It's decreased and decreased, and from those 7 ribs, it's come down to 2.

S.FORM: memlo ŋa mɯ gɤn-ɖa-m oram ikima prətʰa dʰot-to ŋa by-mim ikima tʰuluŋ sama-kam
S.TRANSL: Our system that was born then we follow and it is that of our Thulung group.
